captions.text:
Thurman: WHEN WE GO BACKSTAGE
FOR THE FIGHT,

I FEEL LIKE I'M A DOG
TRAPPED IN A CAGE.
I CANNOT WAIT TO GET OUT.
I START REMEMBERING THE WORDS

OF MY ORIGINAL TRAINER,
BEN GETTY.
"IT'S FIGHT TIME, BOY.
"THIS IS WHAT WE TRAINED FOR.
"HERE'S YOUR MOMENT.

"I WANT YOU TO GO OUT THERE,
AND I WANT YOU TO HURT HIM.
SHOW HIM YOUR POWER."

Narrator: WITH THE WORDS
OF HIS LATE TRAINER
ECHOING IN HIS HEAD,

KEITH "ONE TIME" THURMAN
IS ON A MISSION.
Thurman: HEY, HEY, HEY!
WHAT'S UP, KID?
ALL GOOD, MAN.

12th FLOOR?
12th FLOOR, YEAH.

THERE ARE GONNA BE
ELEVATORS,

AND IT'LL TELL YOU WHICH FLOORS
THOSE ELEVATORS GO TO.

Narrator:
AS THE WINS HAVE MOUNTED,
SO HAS THURMAN'S FAME,

AND WITH IT THE DEMANDS
OF FIGHT WEEK,

WHICH, WHILE RELENTLESS,
ARE A WELCOME CHALLENGE.

Thurman: THIS WEEK, I WAS ABLE
TO BRING MY WHOLE FAMILY OUT.

MY SIBLINGS
HAVE NEVER BEEN OUT HERE.
MY FATHER'S NEVER BEEN OUT HERE.

YOU KNOW, THEY SAY
THERE'S NO PLACE LIKE VEGAS.

Birmingham:
I DON'T WORRY ABOUT THE ACCESS
TAKING HIM OFF HIS GAME.

I THINK HE ENJOYS ALL OF THIS,
AND I THINK IT'S GOOD FOR HIM,

AND I THINK IT'S GOOD FOR HIM
TO BE IN THE PUBLIC EYE.
FOR KEITH, I MEAN,

THIS IS ACTUALLY
MAKING IT IN BOXING.

YOU KNOW YOU'VE MADE IT
WHEN YOU'RE AT THE MGM.

WE'RE IN VEGAS.
WE GOT THE BRIGHT LIGHTS.

FEELING LIKE TUPAC,
ALL EYES ON ME.

FIGHTING AT THIS STAGE
IN THESE BIG ARENAS,

FOR THE MOST PART,
I STAY COMPOSED.
BEN USED TO ALWAYS SAY,

"DON'T FORGET
WHERE YOU COME FROM."

AND WE STARTED FROM THE BOTTOM,
AND NOW WE'RE HERE.

IT'S VERY IMPORTANT FOR KEITH
TO KEEP BEN IN HIS THOUGHTS,

BECAUSE IT WAS
HIS FIRST TRAINER.

YOU NOT ONLY LEARN ABOUT BOXING,
BUT YOU LEARN ABOUT LIFE.

DAN BIRMINGHAM AND MYSELF
STARTED WORKING TOGETHER

AROUND THE TIME
THAT I WAS 14 YEARS OLD.

DAN WAS IN MY CORNER
AS THE SECOND.

AS SOON AS BEN PASSED AWAY,
MY SECOND BECAME MY FIRST.

HIS DEATH WAS DEVASTATING
TO KEITH.

TO EVERYBODY,
BUT ESPECIALLY KEITH.

I'M CONSTANTLY
BRINGING UP HIS NAME,

BRINGING UP
THINGS HE USED TO SAY,

JUST SO KEITH HAS IT
IN HIS MIND ALL THE TIME.
I WAS A LITTLE EMOTIONAL.

FOR ME, IT WAS MORE IMPORTANT
TO BE AROUND PEOPLE THAT KNEW ME

OVER SOMEBODY THAT
COULD JUST SIMPLY HELP ME.
RIGHT THERE AT ST. PETE BOXING,

I FELT LIKE
WE HAD ALL THAT WE NEEDED
TO TURN KEITH "ONE TIME" THURMAN

INTO THE WORLD CHAMPION
THAT BEN GETTY WANTED ME TO BE.

SO, TOMORROW, YOU'RE FIGHTING
A GOOD FIGHTER.

LEONARD BUNDU
IS A GOOD FIGHTER.

WHAT'S YOUR TAKE ON HIM
IN GENERAL AS A FIGHTER?

ACTIVE FOOTWORK,
A LOT OF STUTTER STEP,

RELEASES AN AVERAGE OF
THREE TO SIX PUNCHES AT A TIME.
WHEN HE'S IN HIS GROOVE,

HE THROWS AN AVERAGE
OF 60 PUNCHES PER ROUND.

SO, YOU STUDIED
THE [BLEEP] OUT OF HIM, MAN.

I TOLD YOU I DON'T PLAY.
I TOLD YOU I DON'T PLAY.

LIKE, YOU KEEP GETTING BETTER,
AND YOU GET TO A CERTAIN POINT

WHERE IT WARRANTS YOU
FIGHTING SOME OF THE FIGHTERS

THAT DON'T SEEM
TO WANT TO FIGHT YOU.

HOW FRUSTRATING
OR DIFFICULT IS IT?

I PRETTY MUCH
COUNT MY BLESSINGS,

AND THEN, ON A CELLULAR LEVEL,
THERE'S FRUSTRATION.
[ LAUGHS ]

WHAT DO YOU MEAN
"A CELLULAR LEVEL"?
I LIKE THAT.

YOU KNOW, THAT'S WHY WE HAVE TO
GO INTO PRAYER MEDITATION

AND CALM ALL THAT DOWN.
YEAH, YEAH, YEAH, YEAH.

Narrator: DESPITE THE FIGHT
WITH LEONARD BUNDU
BEING JUST AROUND THE CORNER,

FUTURE OPPONENTS
ARE A CONSTANT TOPIC,

WHETHER IT BE FROM THE MEDIA
OR THURMAN HIMSELF.

I'M TRULY EXCITED
TO BE THE CO-MAIN EVENT.

ME AND MY TEAM,
WE'RE REALLY LOOKING FORWARD

TO GETTING BACK IN THE RING
SATURDAY NIGHT.

I REALLY WOULD LIKE TO FIGHT
THIS GUY RIGHT HERE.
BUT, YOU KNOW, OBVIOUSLY,

WE CAN'T MAKE THAT HAPPEN
RIGHT NOW.

I KNOW THE FANS ARE
TRULY LOOKING FORWARD TO 2015,
BUT IT'S ONE TIME EVERY TIME.
K.O.s FOR LIFE.
YEAH!

DON'T BLINK.
[ LAUGHS ]
THANK YOU, EVERYBODY.
[ APPLAUSE ]

Man: I JUST SPOKE
TO PAULIE MALIGNAGGI.
YOU KNOW WHAT HE TOLD ME?

KEITH THURMAN BEATS
BOTH PACQUIAO AND MAYWEATHER.

WHAT IS IT
YOU'RE GONNA DO

THAT NOBODY'S BEEN ABLE TO DO
47 TIMES?

WILL YOU BE THE FIRST GUY
TO BREAK THE MAY-VINCI CODE
AND TAKE IT TO HIM?
IS IT NOW YOUR TIME NOW?

ARE YOU GONNA JUST
TAKE THE REINS AND TAKE IT
AND BE YOU?

WELL, MY TIME RIGHT NOW
IS SATURDAY NIGHT.

THANK YOU, KEITH.
I APPRECIATE IT.
GOOD LUCK TOMORROW.

Narrator: THE BODY
CANNOT PERFORM AT ITS PEAK
IF THE MIND IS NOT AT EASE.
WITH FIGHT NIGHT ON THE HORIZON,

THURMAN FINDS SOLACE IN CARING
FOR EVERY LAST PHYSICAL DETAIL.

Thurman: I DO MY BEST EVERY DAY
TO JUST RELAX, MAN.
THE LIGHTS AND THE GLAMOUR, MAN,

TO ME, THAT'S REALLY
ALL THEY ARE, MAN, IS LIGHTS.

YOU KNOW, I KNOW WHO I AM
AS A PERSON.

I KNOW
WHAT KIND OF FIGHTER I AM,

AND I HAVE CONFIDENCE
THAT I'M GONNA BE AT THE TOP.
BEN GETTY ALWAYS TOLD ME.

HE SAID,
"WAIT TILL THEY SEE YOU, BOY.
"WAIT TILL THEY SEE YOU

AND YOU JUST START
KNOCKING PEOPLE OUT."

B.G. KNEW WHAT
HE WAS TALKING ABOUT, MAN.

Announcer:
WELL, LADIES AND GENTLEMEN,

PLEASE WELCOME ONE OF
THE YOUNG STARS OF BOXING TODAY,
KEITH "ONE TIME" THURMAN!
[ BELL DINGS ]

Man:
THE BELL AND THE OPENING ROUND.
WE ARE SCHEDULED FOR 12.

Malignaggi: BUNDU'S GOT
A LOT OF CRAFTINESS,

A BIT OF AWKWARDNESS
TO HIS STYLE.

HE'S SWITCHING JUST LIKE
WE THOUGHT HE WOULD, HUH?
SOUTHPAW ANGLE.

SO LET'S SEE
HOW THURMAN ADJUSTS,

AND THURMAN HAS SWITCHED
TO SOUTHPAW.

Man: OH, AND THURMAN ALREADY
DROPS HIM WITH THAT LEFT!

OH, MY GOD!
TWO MINUTES!

IT'S LEFT-HANDED!
SOUTHPAW!
TWO MINUTES!

Man: BUNDU ALREADY TASTES
THE POWER OF THURMAN.

Thurman: AT THAT MOMENT,
WITH THAT KNOCKDOWN,
TO ME IT WAS A SIGNAL

THAT YOU HAVE THIS FIGHT
AND THERE'S NOTHING HE CAN DO.
IT'S YOUR NIGHT.

PLAY HIS GAME
WITH THE ANGLES.
HE SWITCHED, SWITCH.

Man: BUNDU HAS ONLY THROWN
11 PUNCHES SO FAR IN THIS ROUND.

HE'S GOT TO FIND A WAY
TO BE MORE ACTIVE,
EVEN THOUGH IT'S VERY DIFFICULT.

IF I WANTED TO TRULY GET
THE LATE-ROUND KNOCKOUT,

I COULD HAVE BAGGED BUNDU UP
A LITTLE BIT MORE.
Man: CROWD GETTING RESTLESS.

SOME GUYS, YOU'RE JUST
NOT GONNA GET THE K.O.

THEY'RE GONNA FORCE YOU
TO GO THESE ROUNDS.

YOU GOT HIM LOOKING FOR YOUR
PUNCHES.
THAT'S WHAT WE WANT.

DON'T WORRY
ABOUT THIS CROWD [BLEEP].

YOU'RE THE BOSS OUT THERE
EVERY SECOND.

MY TRAINER
AND LISTENING TO MY CORNER
ALLOWED ME TO STAY CALM.

HE SAID THROW POWER,
SO I'M GONNA THROW POWER,
BUT I'M NOT GONNA FORCE POWER.

THERE'S A DIFFERENCE.
Birmingham: BE SMART.

THERE AIN'T NO URGENCY
TO KNOCK HIS ASS OUT.

YOU'RE SHOWING HIM
THIS IS SKILLS, MAN.
[ BELL DINGS ]

THAT'S IT.
GREAT BOXING, MAN.

Announcer: THE WINNER,
KEITH "ONE TIME" THURMAN!

Narrator:
WHILE THE LACK OF A KNOCKOUT
LEFT SOME WANTING MORE,

THE DOMINANCE OF THURMAN'S
PERFORMANCE WAS UNDENIABLE.

Thurman:
WE CAME TO FIGHT OUR FIGHT.
WE CAME TO BOX.

MY CORNER TOLD ME
DON'T WORRY ABOUT IT.
I PROMISE YOU WE'RE GONNA EVOLVE

EACH AND EVERY TIME
THAT WE STEP INTO THAT RING.
I WAS READY

NO MATTER WHAT THE OUTCOME
OF THIS FIGHT REALLY WAS --
A K.O., NON-K.O.

IF SATURDAY NIGHT
MADE PEOPLE THINK

THAT KEITH THURMAN'S BEATABLE,
THEN GET ME BEAT.
